required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate (LDX) in Adolescents With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multi-Center, Parallel-Group, Placebo-Controlled, Forced-dose Titration, Safety and Efficacy Study of Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate (LDX) in Adolescents Aged 13-17 With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the efficacy of LDX treatment group compared to placebo on the change from Baseline ADHD-RS-IV score at endpoint.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at up to 4 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: The ADHD-RS-IV consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Improvement on Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Youth Quality of Life-Research Version (YQOL-R) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: The Youth Quality of Life-research version (YQOL-R) is a validated 56-item generic instrument for comparing quality of life of adolescents across condition groups that scores each question on a scale from 0 (never) to 4 (very often). The YQOL scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale for easy interpretability. Higher scores indicate better quality of life.

intervention.description: Eligible subjects will be randomized in a 1:1:1:1 ratio to a daily morning dose of LDX (30, 50, or 70mg/day) or placebo for a double-blind stepwise forced dose titration (3 weeks) followed by a 1-week Dose Maintenance Period. The test product is LDX, available in 30, 50, and 70mg capsules. All test products will appear identical to placebo to protect the study blind.

Eligible subjects will be randomized in a 1:1:1:1 ratio to a daily morning dose of LDX (30, 50, or 70mg/day) or placebo for a double-blind stepwise forced dose titration (3 weeks) followed by a 1-week Dose Maintenance Period. The test product is LDX, available in 30, 50, and 70mg capsules. All test products will appear identical to placebo to protect the study blind.

Eligible subjects will be randomized in a 1:1:1:1 ratio to a daily morning dose of LDX (30, 50, or 70mg/day) or placebo for a double-blind stepwise forced dose titration (3 weeks) followed by a 1-week Dose Maintenance Period. The test product is LDX, available in 30, 50, and 70mg capsules. All test products will appear identical to placebo to protect the study blind.
Placebo will be identical to test product.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet DSM-IV-TR criteria for a primary diagnosis of ADHD
- Baseline ADHD-RS-IV score >=28
- BP w/in 95th percentile for age, gender, and height
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has controlled or uncontrolled comorbid psychiatric diagnosis
- Subject has conduct disorder
- Suicidal
- Under or overweight
- Concurrent chronic or acute illness that might confound results.

overall_official.affiliation: Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine

facility.name: Psychiatric Centers at San Diego (PCSD-Feighner Research Institute)
Vince and Associates Clinical Research, Inc.
Center for Psychiatry and Behavioral Medicine, Inc

Youth and Family Research Program/WP IC ADHD Research Program

results_reference.citation: Findling RL, Childress AC, Cutler AJ, Gasior M, Hamdani M, Ferreira-Cornwell MC, Squires L. Efficacy and safety of lisdexamfetamine dimesylate in adolescents with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 2011 Apr;50(4):395-405. doi: 10.1016/j.jaac.2011.01.007. Epub 2011 Mar 3.

responsible_party.name_title: Timothy Whitaker, MD/Clinical Research & Development -VP of Global Clinical Medicine

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at up to 4 Weeks
outcome.description: The ADHD-RS-IV consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) is defined as all subjects who took at least one dose of study medication and had a valid Baseline and at least one post-Baseline follow-up assessment of the primary outcome measure (ADHD-RS-IV Total Score)

outcome.title: Youth Quality of Life-Research Version (YQOL-R) Total Score
outcome.description: The Youth Quality of Life-research version (YQOL-R) is a validated 56-item generic instrument for comparing quality of life of adolescents across condition groups that scores each question on a scale from 0 (never) to 4 (very often). The YQOL scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale for easy interpretability. Higher scores indicate better quality of life.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
